title: need know nasa spacex crew-10 mission
content: 6 min read four crew member preparing launch international space station part nasa spacex crew-10 mission perform research , technology demonstration , maintenance activity aboard microgravity laboratory . nasa astronaut anne mcclain , nichole ayers , jaxa ( japan aerospace exploration agency ) astronaut takuya onishi , roscosmos cosmonaut kirill peskov lift launch complex 39a nasa kennedy space center florida . flight 10th crew rotation mission spacex space station , 11th human spaceflight part nasa commercial crew program . team progress through dragon spacecraft milestone crew- , also preparing second-flight falcon 9 booster mission . rocket spacecraft system checkout complete component certified flight , team mate dragon falcon 9 rocket spacex hangar launch site . integrated spacecraft rocket rolled pad raised vertical dry dress rehearsal crew integrated static fire test prior launch . selected nasa astronaut , mcclain second spaceflight . colonel u.s. army , earned bachelor degree mechanical engineering u.s. military academy west point , new york , hold master degree aerospace engineering , international security , strategic study . spokane , washington , native instructor pilot oh-58d kiowa warrior helicopter graduate u.s. naval test pilot school patuxent river , maryland . mcclain more ,300 flight hour 24 rotary fixed-wing aircraft , including more 800 combat , member u.s. woman national rugby team . first spaceflight , mcclain spent 204 day flight engineer during expedition 58 59 completed two spacewalks , totaling 13 hour 8 minute . since , served various role , including branch chief space station assistant chief nasa astronaut office . follow @ astroannimal x @ astro_annimal instagram . mission first spaceflight ayers , selected nasa astronaut . ayers major u.s. air force first member nasa 2021 astronaut class named crew . colorado native graduated air force academy colorado spring bachelor degree mathematics minor russian , member academy varsity volleyball team . later earned master computational applied mathematics rice university houston . ayers served instructor pilot mission commander t-38 adair f-22 raptor , leading multinational multiservice mission worldwide . more ,400 total flight hour , including more 200 combat . follow @ astro_ayers x @ astro_ayers instagram . 113 day space , crew-10 mark onishi second trip space station . after selected astronaut jaxa , flew flight engineer expedition 48 , becoming first japanese astronaut robotically capture cygnus spacecraft . also constructed new experimental environment aboard kibo , station japanese experiment module . after first spaceflight , onishi became certified jaxa flight director , leading team responsible operating kibo jaxa mission control tsukuba , japan . hold bachelor degree aeronautics astronautics university tokyo , pilot nippon airway , flying more ,700 flight hour boeing . follow astro_onishi x. crew-10 mission also peskov first spaceflight . before selection cosmonaut , earned degree engineering ulyanovsk civil aviation school co-pilot boeing 757 767 aircraft airline nordwind ikar . assigned test cosmonaut , additional experience skydiving , zero-gravity training , scuba diving , wilderness survival . following liftoff , falcon 9 rocket accelerate dragon approximately ,500 mph . orbit , crew spacex title: kuiper belt
content: kuiper belt doughnut-shaped region icy object beyond orbit neptune . home pluto most known dwarf planet comet . kuiper belt large , doughnut-shaped region icy body extending far beyond orbit neptune . kuiper belt home pluto arrokoth . world visited nasa 's new horizon spacecraft . may million icy world kuiper belt left over formation solar system . most know kuiper belt come ground-based telescope hubble space telescope . one spacecraft visited kuiper belt . nasa new horizon flew past pluto july 2015 sending back first clear , close-up image tiny world . jan. , , spacecraft flew kuiper belt object later named arrokoth . 's vast mysterious , cold dark . title: preguntas frecuentes : la verdadera historia del cuidado de la salud de los astronautas en el espacio
content: 8 min read read story english . la estaci n espacial internacional e el hogar de la humanidad en el espacio una estaci n de investigaci n que gira en rbita sobre la tierra unos 400 kil metro ( 250 millas ) de altura . la nasa sus socios internacionales han mantenido una presencia humana continuum bordo de la estaci n espacial durante de 24 o , haciendo investigaciones que no e posible realizar en la tierra . la gente que vive trabaja bordo de este laboratorio en microgravedad tambi n forma parte de la investigaciones que se llevan cabo , ellos ayudan abordar complejos problemas de la salud humana en la tierra preparan la humanidad para viajar lejos que nunca , incluyendo la luna marte . estas son algunas de la preguntas frecuentes sobre c mo la nasa su equipo de dicos , psic logo , nutricionistas , cient ficos del ejercicio otros profesionales especializados garantizan la salud la condici n f sica de los astronautas bordo del laboratorio orbital . una misi n pica la estaci n espacial internacional dura unos seis meses , pero puede variar en funci n del calendario de visitas de nave espaciales , la prioridades de la misi n otros factores . los astronautas de la nasa tambi n han permanecido bordo de la estaci n espacial durante per odo de tiempo largo . estas se conocen como misiones de larga duraci n , misiones anteriores de este tipo han proporcionado la nasa cuantiosos datos sobre los vuelos espaciales largo plazo sus efectos en el cuerpo humano , los cuales la agencia aplica cualquier misi n tripulada . durante la misiones de larga duraci n , el equipo de profesionales dicos de la nasa se centrum en optimizar la salud f sica conductual de los astronautas su desempe , para ayudar garantizar el xito de la misi n. estos esfuerzos tambi n ayudan la nasa prepararse para futuras misiones humanas la luna , marte . la nasa tiene un equipo de dicos , psic logo otros especialistas en tierra que se dedican dar apoyo la salud el bienestar de los astronautas ante , durante despu de cada misi n espacial . la nasa asigna cada tripulaci n dicos con formaci n especializada en medicina espacial , denominados dicos de la tripulaci n de vuelo , una vez que la tripulaci n ha sido seleccionada para una misi n. los dicos de la tripulaci n de vuelo supervisan la atenci n de salud la capacitaci n dica mientras los miembros de la tripulaci n se preparan para su misi n , monitorean la salud de la tripulaci n ante , durante despu de su misi n la estaci n espacial . el equipo de salud conductual de la nasa proporciona servicios de apoyo psicol gico determinados de manera individual para los miembros de la tripulaci n sus familias durante cada misi n. garantizar que los astronautas puedan mantener su vitalidad en entornos extremos comienza tan pronto se inicia el proceso de selecci n de astronautas , en el que los candidatos son evaluados en capacidades como su adaptabilidad resiliencia . los astronautas reciben una formaci n exhaustiva que le ayuda utilizar herramientas tratamientos de autoevaluaci n para gestionar su salud conductual . la nasa tambi n ofrece capacitaci n en destrezas expedicionarias fin de preparar cada astronauta para la misiones en capacidades importantes , como los cuidados personales el cuidado del equipo , la comunicaciones la destrezas de liderazgo colaboraci n. para ayudar mantener la motivaci n la moral bordo de la estaci n espacial , los astronautas pueden enviar correos electr nicos , hacer llamadas videoconferencias con sus familiares amigo , recibir paquetes personales enviados bordo de la misiones de reabastecimiento de carga de la nasa sostener teleconferencias con un psic logo , si e necesario . en microgravedad , sin la carga continuum de la gravedad de la tierra , se producen muchos cambios en el cuerpo humano . la nasa entiende muchas de la respuestas del sistema humano al entorno espacial , entre la que se cuentan la adaptaciones la densidad sea , la salud muscular , sensitivomotora cardiovascular , pero todav queda mucho por aprender . estos efectos de los vuelos espaciales var de uno otro astronauta , por lo que los dicos de la tripulaci n de vuelo de la nasa monitorean regularmente la salud de cada miembro de la tripulaci n durante una misi n e individualizan la rutinas de dieta acondicionamiento f sico para dar prioridad la salud el estado f sico durante su permanencia en el espacio . todos los astronautas bordo del laboratorio en rbita participan en plane de ejercicio espec ficamente dise ado similares los de la tierra . para mantener su fuerza resistencia , los miembros de la tripulaci n tienen programadas do horas medium de ejercicio diario para sustentar su salud muscular , sea , aer bica sensitivomotora . el equipo actual bordo de la estaci n espacial incluye el dispositivo avanzado de ejercicio resistivo ( ared , por sus siglas en ingl ) , que imita el levantamiento de pesas ; una cinta de correr , llamada t2 ; el cicloerg metro con sistema de aislamiento estabilizaci n de vibraciones ( cevis , por sus siglas en ingl ) para el ejercicio cardiovascular . la nutrici n desempe un papel fundamental en el mantenimiento de la salud el rendimiento ptimo de un astronauta ante , durante despu de su misi n. la alimentaci n tambi n cumple un rol psicosocial durante la prolongada estancia de un astronauta bordo de la estaci n espacial . los expertos que trabajan en el laboratorio de sistemas de alimentaci n espacial de la nasa en el centro johnson en houston desarrollan alimentos nutritivos apetitosos . los miembros de la tripulaci n tienen pueden complementar la opciones del men est ndar con sus plato favoritos personales , que pueden brindar un sabor hogare o. los nutricionistas cient ficos de bioqu mica nutricional de la nasa determinan los nutrientes ( vitaminas , minerales , calor ) que los astronautas necesitan mientras est n en el espacio . este equipo lleva el registro de lo que come cada miembro de la tripulaci n mediante un programa de seguimiento basado en computadoras de tableta , que cada astronauta completa diario . los datos de la aplicaci n se env semanalmente los nutricionistas para controlar la ingesta diet tica . el lisis de la muestras de sangre orina de los astronautas que son tomadas ante , durante despu de la misiones espaciales e una parte crucial del estudio de c mo responden sus cuerpos la condiciones nicas de los vuelos espaciales . estas muestras proporcionan informaci n valiosa sobre c mo cada astronauta se adapta la microgravedad , la radiaci n otros factores que afectan la fisiolog humana en el espacio . adem de su capacitaci n cnica , los astronautas participan en la formaci n de destrezas de trabajo en equipo . aprenden destrezas eficaces para la vida en grupo c mo cuidarse apoyarse unos otros . debido su naturaleza remota aislada , los vuelos espaciales de larga duraci n pueden dificultar el trabajo en equipo . los astronautas deben mantener la conciencia situacional e implementar el programa de vuelo en un entorno en constante cambio . por lo tanto , la comunicaci n efectiva e fundamental cuando se trabaja en equipo bordo de la estaci n con diferentes equipos de soporte en tierra . los astronautas tambi n deben ser capaces de comunicar informaci n compleja persona con diferente formaci n profesional . en ltima instancia , los astronautas son persona que viven trabajan junta bordo de la estaci n deben ser capaces de llevar cabo un trabajo altamente cnico resolver cualquier problema interpersonal que pueda surgir . todos los astronautas reciben capacitaci n dica tienen contacto regular con un equipo de dicos que vigilan de cerca su salud desde tierra . la nasa tambi n mantiene una farmacia bien surtida un conjunto de equipamientos dicos bordo de la estaci n espacial para atender diversas afecciones lesiones . si una emergencia dica requiere volver la tierra , la tripulaci n regresar en la nave espacial que fue llevada bordo para recibir atenci n dica urgente en tierra . puedes obtener informaci n sobre la direcci n de salud desempe humano de la nasa ( en ingl ) en : www.nasa.gov/hhp

title: james webb space telescope
content: webb premier observatory next decade , serving thousand astronomer worldwide . study every phase history universe . webb study every phase history universe , ranging first luminous glow after big bang , formation solar system capable supporting life planet like earth , evolution solar system . webb launched dec. 25th . not orbit around earth like hubble space telescope , orbit sun .5 million kilometer ( 1 million mile ) away earth called second lagrange point l2 . mission type partner launch arrival l2 extending tantalizing discovery hubble space telescope . big fold origami-style fit rocket unfold like transformer space . webb orbit sun .5 million kilometer earth . title: naca

war . u.s. responded europe aeronautical trailblazing 1915 forming committee government , military , industry leader . called national advisory committee aeronautics , naca letter pronounced.the naca made difference 1929 technology inventor awarded collier trophy , aviation highest honor . founded , langley memorial aeronautical laboratory first established naca facility . naca research center air travel one safest mode transportation . thirteen people naca 's langley laboratory arrived muroc army air field 1946 support testing rocket plane first flew faster sound year later . seed grew flight research center nasa operates today . 1915 , naca led world aviation research . during golden age aeronautical innovation , air travel evolved small wood fabric airplane flying few hundred foot high rocket-propelled aircraft built exotic metal cruising edge space . commercial jet age taking promise supersonic airliner beyond horizon . when soviet union shocked world sputnik , u.s. reacted title: nasa webb wow incredible detail actively forming star system
content: high-resolution near-infrared light captured nasa james webb space telescope show extraordinary new detail structure lynds ( l483 ) . two actively forming star responsible shimmering ejection gas dust gleam orange , blue , purple representative color image . over ten thousand year , central protostars periodically ejected gas dust , spewing tight , fast jet slightly slower outflow trip across space . when more recent ejection hit older one , material crumple twirl based density colliding . over time , chemical reaction within ejection surrounding cloud produced range molecule , like carbon monoxide , methanol , several organic compound . two protostars responsible scene center hourglass shape , opaque horizontal disk cold gas dust fit within single pixel . much farther , above below flattened disk where dust thinner , bright light star shine through gas dust , forming large semi-transparent orange cone . equally important notice where star light blocked look exceptionally dark , wide v-shapes offset 90 degree orange cone . area may look like no material , actually where surrounding dust densest , little starlight penetrates . look carefully area , webb sensitive nircam ( near-infrared camera ) picked up distant star muted orange pinpoint behind dust . where view free obscuring dust , star shine brightly white blue . star jet outflow wound up twisted warped . find example , look toward top right edge where prominent orange arc . shock front , where star ejection slowed existing , denser material . , look little lower , where orange meet pink . , material look like tangled mess . new , incredibly fine detail webb revealed , require detailed study explain . turn lower half . , gas dust appear thicker . zoom find tiny light purple pillar . point toward central star nonstop wind , formed material within dense enough yet blown away . l483 large fit single webb snapshot , image taken fully capture upper section outflow , why lower section partially shown . ( see larger view observed nasa 's retired spitzer space telescope . ) symmetry asymmetry cloud may eventually explained researcher reconstruct history star ejection , part updating model produce effect . astronomer also eventually calculate how much material star expelled , molecule created when material smashed together , how dense area . million year , when star finished forming , may mass sun . outflow cleared area sweeping away semi-transparent ejection . may remain tiny disk gas dust where planet may eventually form . l483 named american astronomer beverly t. lynds , published extensive catalog dark bright nebula early 1960s . carefully examining photographic plate ( preceded film ) first palomar observatory sky survey , accurately recording object coordinate characteristic . catalog provided astronomer detailed map dense dust cloud where star form critical resource astronomical community decade before first digital file became available access internet widespread . james webb space telescope world premier space science observatory . webb solve mystery solar system , look beyond distant world around star , probe mysterious structure origin universe place . webb international program led nasa partner , esa ( european space agency ) canadian space agency . click image open larger version . view/download image product resolution article space telescope science institute . laura betz - goddard space flight center , greenbelt , md . claire blome - telescope science institute , baltimore , md . christine pulliam - telescope science institute , baltimore , md . more webb news more webb image webb science theme webb mission page view more : webb image similar protostar outflow hh 211 hh /47 animation video : exploring star planet formation explore jet emitted young star multiple wavelength : viewspace interactive read more : birth star hubble observation webb telescope ? title: ogle-gd-wd-0001 extremely hot pulsating pre-white dwarf , observation find
content: march , 2025 report article reviewed according science x 's editorial process policy . editor highlighted following attribute ensuring content 's credibility : fact-checked preprint trusted source proofread tomasz nowakowski , phys.org astronomer poland germany performed photometric spectroscopic observation blue variable object designated ogle-gd-wd- . result , found investigated object extremely hot pulsating pre-white dwarf pg 1159 spectral type . finding detailed research paper published february 24 arxiv preprint server . white dwarf ( wds ) stellar core left behind after star exhausted nuclear fuel . due high gravity , known atmosphere either pure hydrogen pure helium . however , small fraction wds show trace heavier element . although wds relatively small size , comparable earth , few million time more massive planet . pre-white dwarf ( pwds ) few time larger slated shrink size , eventually becoming wds within few thousand year . ogle-gd-wd-0001 first spotted 2013 blue object exhibiting sinusoidal light variation amplitude .01 mag i-band period .34 minute . object initially classified pulsating white dwarf . however , subsequent study put wd status ogle-gd-wd-0001 question . latest observation object , made team astronomer led pawe pietrukowicz university warsaw , poland , provide evidence ogle-gd-wd-0001 pulsating pre-white dwarf . observation found ogle-gd-wd-0001 showcase brightness variation property typical pulsating pg 1159 star . so-called pg 1159 star , gw virginis pulsators , hot hydrogen-deficient precursor white dwarf , retaining hydrogen envelope , named after prototype . study found atmosphere ogle-gd-wd-0001 composed helium carbon equal proportion , .005 mass fraction oxygen . effective temperature ogle-gd-wd-0001 found ,000 k , luminosity estimated level ,000 solar luminosity . astronomer noted no trace planetary nebula around pwd . author paper concluded ogle-gd-wd-0001 therefore among hottest gw virginis pulsators known date . moreover , close blue edge gw virginis instability strip . observation ogle-gd-wd-0001 required , focused obtaining higher resolution spectrum pre-white dwarf , would allow more accurate determination physical parameter . more information : p. pietrukowicz et al , extremely hot pulsating pre-white dwarf ogle , arxiv ( ) . doi : . /arxiv . .17577 journal information : arxiv journal information : arxiv 2025 science x network

title: neural network deciphers gravitational wave merging neutron star second
content: march , 2025 article reviewed according science x 's editorial process policy . editor highlighted following attribute ensuring content 's credibility : fact-checked peer-reviewed publication trusted source proofread max planck society binary neutron star merger occur million light-year away earth . interpreting gravitational wave produce present major challenge traditional data-analysis method . signal correspond minute data current detector potentially hour day data future observatory . analyzing massive data set computationally expensive time-consuming . international team scientist developed machine learning algorithm , called dingo-bns ( deep inference gravitational-wave observation binary neutron star ) save valuable time interpreting gravitational wave emitted binary neutron star merger . trained neural network fully characterize system merging neutron star second , compared hour fastest traditional method . result published nature under title `` real-time inference binary neutron star merger using machine learning . `` neutron star merger emit visible light ( subsequent kilonova explosion ) electromagnetic radiation addition gravitational wave . `` rapid accurate analysis gravitational-wave data crucial localize source point telescope right direction quickly possible observe accompanying signal , `` say first author publication , maximilian dax , ph.d. student empirical inference department max planck institute intelligent system ( mpi-is ) , eth zurich elli institute bingen . real-time method could set new standard data analysis neutron star merger , giving broader astronomy community more time point telescope toward merging neutron star soon large detector ligo-virgo-kagra ( lvk ) collaboration identify . `` current rapid analysis algorithm used lvk make approximation sacrifice accuracy . new study address shortcoming , `` say jonathan gair , group leader astrophysical cosmological relativity department max planck institute gravitational physic potsdam science park . indeed , machine learning framework fully characterizes neutron star merger ( e.g . , mass , spin , location ) one second without making approximation . allows , among thing , quickly determine sky position 30 % more precisely . work quickly accurately , neural network provide critical information joint observation gravitational-wave detector telescope . help search light electromagnetic signal produced merger make best possible use expensive telescope observing time . `` gravitational wave analysis particularly challenging binary neutron star , dingo-bns , develop various technical innovation . includes , example , method event-adaptive data compression , `` say stephen green , ukri future leader fellow university nottingham . bernhard sch lkopf , director empirical inference department mpi-is elli institute bingen add , `` study showcase effectiveness combining modern machine learning method physical domain knowledge . `` dingo-bns could one day help observe electromagnetic signal before time collision two neutron star . `` early multi-messenger observation could provide new insight merger process subsequent kilonova , still mysterious , `` say alessandra buonanno , director astrophysical cosmological relativity department max planck institute gravitational physic . more information : maximilian dax , real-time inference binary neutron star merger using machine learning , nature ( ) . doi : . /s41586- - -z. www.nature.com/articles/s41586- - -z journal information : nature journal information : nature title: gemini south observes ultra-hot nova erupting surprising chemical signature
content: march , 2025 article reviewed according science x 's editorial process policy . editor highlighted following attribute ensuring content 's credibility : fact-checked peer-reviewed publication trusted source proofread association university research astronomy nova explosion occur binary star system white dwarf dense remnant dead star continually siphon stellar material nearby companion star . outer atmosphere companion gather onto surface white dwarf reach temperature hot enough spark eruption . almost nova discovered to-date observed erupt . few observed erupt more , classified recurrent nova . span between eruption nova vary little one year many decade . less dozen recurrent nova observed within milky way galaxy , far more extragalactic , meaning located outside milky way . studying extragalactic nova help build astronomer ' understanding how different environment affect nova eruption . first recurrent extragalactic nova observed lmc 12a ( lmc68 ) , located large magellanic cloud satellite galaxy milky way . nova recurrent timescale four year third-shortest nova consists white dwarf companion red subgiant ( star much larger sun ) . discovered 1968 eruption observed fairly regularly since . most recent eruption , august , first captured neil gehrels swift observatory , closely monitoring nova every month since 2020 eruption . given known recurrent timescale , astronomer anticipating eruption , lmc68 delivered right cue . follow-up observation conducted nine day after initial outburst carnegie institution 's magellan baade telescope , 22 day after initial outburst gemini south telescope , one half international gemini observatory . using technique spectroscopy , team observed lmc68 's near-infrared light , allowed study nova 's ultra-hot phase during many element highly energized . studying phase astronomer learn most extreme process play eruption . study first ever near-infrared spectroscopic observation extragalactic recurrent nova . after initial eruption lmc68 's light faded rapidly , gemini south 's flamingos-2 instrument still captured strong signal ionized silicon atom , specifically silicon atom stripped nine 14 electron , requires incredible amount energy form radiation violent collision . earlier spectrum magellan , near-infrared light ionized silicon alone shined 95 time brighter light emitted sun added up across wavelength ( x-ray , ultraviolet , visible , infrared , radio ) . when gemini observed line several day later signal faded , silicon emission still dominated spectrum . `` ionized silicon shining almost 100 time brighter sun unprecedented , `` say tom geballe , noirlab emeritus astronomer co-author paper appearing monthly notice royal astronomical society . `` signal shocking , 's also shocking 's not . `` nova found milky way typically emit numerous near-infrared signature highly-excited element , lmc68 's spectrum contained ionized silicon feature . `` would 've expected also see signature highly energized sulfur , phosphorus , calcium aluminum , `` say geballe . `` surprising absence , combined presence great strength silicon signature , implied unusually high gas temperature , modeling confirmed , `` add co-author sumner starrfield , regent professor astrophysics arizona state university . team estimate , during nova 's early post-explosion phase , temperature expelled gas reached 3 million degree celsius ( .4 million degree fahrenheit ) , making one hottest nova ever recorded . extreme temperature suggests highly violent eruption , team theorizes due condition nova 's environment . discover latest science , tech , space over ,000 subscriber rely phys.org daily insight . sign up free newsletter get update breakthrough , innovation , research matter daily weekly . large magellanic cloud star lower metallicity milky way , meaning contains lower abundance element heavier hydrogen helium , referred metal astronomer . high-metallicity system , heavy element trap heat white dwarf 's surface eruption occur early accretion process . without heavy element , more matter build up white dwarf 's surface before get hot enough ignite , causing explosion erupt far greater violence . additionally , expelled gas collides atmosphere companion red subgiant , causing huge shock elevates temperature collision . prior collecting data , starrfield predicted accretion low-metallicity material onto white dwarf would result more violent nova explosion . observation analysis presented broadly agreement prediction . `` small number recurrent nova detected within galaxy , understanding object progressed episodically , `` say martin still , nsf program director international gemini observatory . `` broadening range galaxy using largest astronomical telescope available , like gemini south , astronomer increase rate progress critically measure behavior object different chemical environment . `` more information : evans et al , near-infrared spectroscopy lmc recurrent
